President Trump was asked today if he thinks he should get a Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts to organize a summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.

"They're working out times and meeting times," he said

Trump continued: "If it doesn't take place, that's fine.
Trump said he's not sure what's happening with North Korea because it looks like the meeting is on.
I want to have peace in the world, more so than the Nobel Peace Prize," he said.
I think it's got tremendous potential for its leader and for its people.
If it does take place, I think some tremendous things can happen.
Earlier this week, North Korea threatened to cancel the summit.
North Korea is going to be very important."
I think it's got tremendous potential.
It's a tremendous part of the world.
But we'll see how it all works out.
